The following chunks are from the [knitr with R Markdown tutorial](https://kbroman.org/knitr_knutshell/pages/Rmarkdown.html)

The basic chunk shows code and output.
```{r test_chunk_basic}
x <- rnorm(100)
y <- 2*x + rnorm(100)
```

This chunk shows only output; no code.
```{r test_chunk_no_code_show, echo=FALSE}
x <- rnorm(100)
y <- 2*x + rnorm(100)
cor(x, y)
```

This chunk shows only the code and hides output.
```{r test_chunk_no_result_show, results="hide"}
x <- rnorm(100)
y <- 2*x + rnorm(100)
cor(x, y)
```

This chunk shows nothing at all:
```{r test_chunk_nothing_show, include=FALSE}
x <- rnorm(100)
y <- 2*x + rnorm(100)
cor(x, y)
```

...

To use plot a fig.width & height must be set:
```{r scatterplot, fig.width=8, fig.height=6}
plot(x,y)
```
